intro: Australluma peschii, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its strap-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its fibrous leaves have been traditionally used by Māori for making garments and baskets. Australluma peschii plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various native wildlife.
